title: Is this more of a software thing? MacBook Pro sn c02hng7jdv13
message:
She is from 2011, I have been told when switching it on it gives a padlock symbol on screen, but I haven't managed to see that yet. All I have seen from it is when switching on you get the apple symbol, then a loading bar, then a progress wheel. The loading bar goes about half way then it goes off screen, progress wheel stays there with apple symbol then the thing switches off, the screen it gives is attached to this post. When switching on again, it does the same thing. 
Trying to load an internet restore from switching on then command and r gives the padlock symbol on screen and it wants a password. I don't know the password, but the owner has tried their own password and it does not move on. I am told they bought it from Groupon so my thinking is, the computer was refurbished and used to belong to someone else so it wants the original password it maybe first had when it was brand  new. 
I am thinking getting round this by changing the password if possible and in older macs I have got round the password problem by changing the amount of ram which allows you passed the password problem that then lets you restore the computer or reset the password.  I did that on a MacBook Pro of my own some years ago, but it from a 17 inch version from about 2006/2007. Has anyone seen this issue before or know a way round it.
A different hard drive has also been tried which didn't change anything.
Thanks for reading

title: Is this more of a software thing? MacBook Pro sn c02hng7jdv13
message: Picture attached

title: Is this more of a software thing? MacBook Pro sn c02hng7jdv13
message: Pull BIOS chip and read it. Post dump file to be unlocked.

title: Is this more of a software thing? MacBook Pro sn c02hng7jdv13
message: OK what do I read the chip with?

title: Is this more of a software thing? MacBook Pro sn c02hng7jdv13
message: TL866, EZP2010, or any other programmer that supports SPI devices.

title: Is this more of a software thing? MacBook Pro sn c02hng7jdv13
message: Cool thanks, where about is the chip on the board?

title: Is this more of a software thing? MacBook Pro sn c02hng7jdv13
message: U6100 near the PCH.

title: Is this more of a software thing? MacBook Pro sn c02hng7jdv13
message: Thanks, any updates I will post up

title: Is this more of a software thing? MacBook Pro sn c02hng7jdv13
message: I've had good success with just replacing that chip from donor boards of the same board number.

title: Is this more of a software thing? MacBook Pro sn c02hng7jdv13
message: Yeah!! And what about ME region???

title: Is this more of a software thing? MacBook Pro sn c02hng7jdv13
message: haven't had an issue yet with them.

title: Is this more of a software thing? MacBook Pro sn c02hng7jdv13
message: NO, ignore that advice! YOU CANNOT SWAP ROMS BETWEEN BOARDS ON iCORE! All sorts of weird issues will happen.

title: Is this more of a software thing? MacBook Pro sn c02hng7jdv13
message: Sorry if i was wrong.

title: Is this more of a software thing? MacBook Pro sn c02hng7jdv13
message: I guess now you'll never do it again ;) It's fine on C2D machines but on iCore it will fuck up the ME region.

title: Is this more of a software thing? MacBook Pro sn c02hng7jdv13
message: good to know. i havent tried on any retina boards and wont be.

title: Is this more of a software thing? MacBook Pro sn c02hng7jdv13
message:
Hi,
So I have .bin file read from the bios chip. What needs to be done now?

title: Is this more of a software thing? MacBook Pro sn c02hng7jdv13
message: Upload it somewhere and send me the link.

title: Is this more of a software thing? MacBook Pro sn c02hng7jdv13
message: [url]https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/67533935/820-2936.zip[/url]

title: Is this more of a software thing? MacBook Pro sn c02hng7jdv13
message:
[url]https://drive.google.com/file/d/0ByfhQ_x0v-tZWVhUdUxkZUF0VEk/view?usp=sharing[/url]

Do a PRAM reset on the first boot and reinstall OSX!

title: Is this more of a software thing? MacBook Pro sn c02hng7jdv13
message:
Oh cool!! Thanks for that Duke. I have looked at the file and can see the change. Perfect. Once it is done I will update.
Thanks again.

title: Is this more of a software thing? MacBook Pro sn c02hng7jdv13
message: The computer is back together, but not switching on. When trying to switch on from battery only the cpu fans spins for maybe 2 seconds then stops. The power light comes on in that time and then goes off when the fan stops. When connecting to power, the fans starts to spin for 2 seconds, then stops and starts again. Still will not switch on. I tried a p tram reset just in case and nothing happens so it isn't switching on. When power is connected, the light on the connector lights up green then goes red. Has something gone wrong with the programming or am I diagnosing a power problem?

title: Is this more of a software thing? MacBook Pro sn c02hng7jdv13
message: check current sensing

title: Is this more of a software thing? MacBook Pro sn c02hng7jdv13
message:
You didn't correctly flash the chip, put in in the wrong way, killed the chip or killed something else. I have no way of telling.

Pull chip and verify it was correctly flashed, check orientation. If that all is OK then flash back original file, it is possible I messed up of course.

title: Is this more of a software thing? MacBook Pro sn c02hng7jdv13
message: Ok I will look for damage around the chip and get the chip off then check the information on it and get back.

title: Is this more of a software thing? MacBook Pro sn c02hng7jdv13
message: Are there actually 2 topics on the same machine. Please use only one!
